intro: Senecio pohlii, commonly known as the Pohli's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leaf structures. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually gray-green with a fuzzy texture, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Senecio pohlii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
